meanings.definition: Bread displayed in the Jewish tabernacle as an offering to God.
meanings.sent1: The shewbread was placed on a special table in the tabernacle.
meanings.sent2: People brought shewbread to the tabernacle as a gift to God.
meanings.sent3: The shewbread looked so delicious that even the priests were tempted to sneak a bite.
meanings.sent4: The shewbread, like a sacred treasure, gleamed under the temple's soft light.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the shewbread filled the tabernacle, a fragrant offering to the heavens.

meanings.definition: To display or present bread in a religious context.
meanings.sent1: The priest will shewbread during the ceremony.
meanings.sent2: She will shewbread the loaves at the altar.
meanings.sent3: The baker decided to shewbread his finest creations at the church fair.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the baker shewbread his bread, creating a beautiful display.
meanings.sent5: The act of shewbreading the bread added a reverent touch to the religious service.
